text: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
The more of me you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for very long. What am I?
I’m always in front of you but can’t be seen. What am I?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What has one head, one foot, and four legs?
What comes at night without being called, and is lost in the day without being stolen?
I fly without wings, I cry without eyes. Whenever I go, darkness flies. What am I?
What can you keep after giving it to someone?
I can fill a room, but I take up no space. What am I?
The more you take away from me, the bigger I get. What am I?
What has keys but can’t open locks?
What can travel around the world while staying in the same spot?
What has a neck but no head?
What can run but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps, and has a mouth but never talks?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
The more you have of me, the less you see. What am I?
What has many needles but doesn’t sew?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
What has an eye but can’t see?
What has hands but can’t clap?
What can be caught but never thrown?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
I’m not alive, but I can grow. I don’t have lungs, but I need air. I don’t have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
What has no beginning, end, or middle?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
The more you share me, the less you have. What am I?
What has legs but doesn’t walk?
